result.execSummary:
Devin Lee Marcum was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Devin Lee Marcum was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Extradition-Arrest Prior to Requisition - Dept of Corrections Illinois (parole)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devin Lee Marcum

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Jason Mitchel Daane in court.  Mason C. Braunschweig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant extradited.

Defendant Devin Lee Marcum in court in custody with attorney Jason Mitchel Daane.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant sworn, waives extradition freely and voluntarily; Waiver signed in open court.  Status conference scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Devin Lee Marcum in court in custody with attorney Jason Mitchel Daane.  Mason C. Braunschweig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Devin Lee Marcum in court with attorney Ellen Craker for Jason Mitchel Daane.  Gwanny J. Tjoa appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bond to be heard at next hearing.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
